intro: Calandrinia thyrsoidea, commonly known as the redstem false flax, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its flowers are usually pink to red in color, and it produces capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Calandrinia thyrsoidea is used in some regions for ornamental purposes due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
